intro: Manettia glabra, commonly known as the smooth manettia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Manettia glabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in tropical forests.
